TurtleMobility Class Reference
[mobility - modules handling the mobility of the hosts]

LOGO-style movement model, with the script coming from XML. See NED file for more info. More...

#include <TurtleMobility.h>

Inherits LineSegmentsMobilityBase.

00275 {
00276     // "statement either doesn't have a child, or it's a <repeat> and loop count is already pushed on the stack"
00277     ASSERT(!nextStatement->getFirstChild() || (!strcmp(nextStatement->getTagName(),"repeat") && !loopVars.empty()));
00278 
00279     if (nextStatement->getFirstChild() && (loopVars.top()!=0 || (loopVars.pop(),false)))   // !=0: positive or -1
00280     {
00281         // statement must be a <repeat> if it has children; repeat count>0 must be
00282         // on the stack; let's start doing the body.
00283         nextStatement = nextStatement->getFirstChild();
00284     }
00285     else if (!nextStatement->getNextSibling())
00286     {
00287         // no sibling -- either end of <repeat> body, or end of script
00288         ASSERT(nextStatement->getParentNode()==turtleScript ? loopVars.empty() : !loopVars.empty());
00289         if (!loopVars.empty())
00290         {
00291             // decrement and check loop counter
00292             if (loopVars.top()!=-1)  // -1 means infinity
00293                 loopVars.top()--;
00294             if (loopVars.top()!=0)  // positive or -1
00295             {
00296                 // go to beginning of <repeat> block again
00297                 nextStatement = nextStatement->getParentNode()->getFirstChild();
00298             }
00299             else
00300             {
00301                 // end of loop -- locate next statement after the <repeat>
00302                 nextStatement = nextStatement->getParentNode();
00303                 gotoNextStatement();
00304             }
00305         }
00306         else
00307         {
00308             // end of script
00309             nextStatement = NULL;
00310         }
00311     }
00312     else
00313 
00314     {
00315         // go to next statement (must exist -- see "if" above)
00316         nextStatement = nextStatement->getNextSibling();
00317     }

void TurtleMobility::initialize ( int  stage  )  [virtual]

Initializes mobility model parameters.

Reads the parameters. If the host is not stationary it calculates a random position and schedules a timer to trigger the first movement

Reimplemented from BaseMobility.

Will set a new targetTime and targetPos
